de.mrapp.util

Class FileUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.util.FileUtil

  • public final class FileUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    An utility class, which provides static methods, which allow to handle files.
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • mkdir

        public static void mkdir(@NotNull
                         @NotNull java.io.File directory)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a specific directory, if it does not already exist. It is assumed, that the parent directories already exist. If the parent directories should be created as well, use the mkdirs-method instead.
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory, which should be created, as an instance of the class File. The directory may not be null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - The exception, which is thrown, if an error occurred while creating the directory

      • mkdirs

        public static void mkdirs(@NotNull
                          @NotNull java.io.File directory)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a specific directory, if it does not already exist. If necessary the parent directories are created as well. If no parent directories should be created, use the mkdir-method instead.
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory, which should be created, as an instance of the class File. The directory may not be null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - The exception, which is thrown, if an error occurred while creating the directory

      • delete

        public static void delete(@NotNull
                          @NotNull java.io.File file)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes a specific file. If a directory and its contents should be deleted, use the deleteRecursively-method instead.
        Parameters:
        file - The file, which should be deleted, as an instance of the class File. The file may not be null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - The exception, which is thrown, if an error occurred while deleting the file

      • deleteRecursively

        public static void deleteRecursively(@NotNull
                                     @NotNull java.io.File file)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes a specific file or directory. If the file is a directory, all contained files and subdirectories are deleted recursively.
        Parameters:
        file - The file or directory, which should be deleted, as an instance of the class File. The file or directory may not be null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - The exception, which is thrown, if an error occurs while deleting the file or directory

      • createNewFile

        public static void createNewFile(@NotNull
                                 @NotNull java.io.File file)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new, empty file.
        Parameters:
        file - The file, which should be created, as an instance of the class File. The file may not be null. If the file is a directory, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - The exception, which is thrown, if an error occurs while creating the file

      • createNewFile

        public static void createNewFile(@NotNull
                                 @NotNull java.io.File file,
                                 boolean overwrite)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new, empty file.
        Parameters:
        file - The file, which should be created, as an instance of the class File. The file may not be null. If the file is a directory, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
        overwrite - True, if the file should be overwritten, if it does already exist, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - The exception, which is thrown, if an error occurs while creating the file
